name: 46694R302 - ITP - LEVEL 01 - Installation of RIS Ladder Bracket
template name: 46694R302 - ITP - LEVEL 01 - Installation of RIS Ladder Bracket

name: Ladder bracket connection to the structure
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
Number of fixings, location of fixings
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
CHARACTERISTICS - RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement
CHARACTERISTICS - AS1891.2 1.4 System Acceptance Criteria a. AS/NZS 1891.4.2009 Section (9). RIS Ladder Bracket Installation Requirement.

REFERENCE - Installed equipment is positioned so it can be accessed in a secure and safe manner using normal ladder safety protocols. e.g. 3 points of contact, tie off, 4 to 1 angle and 1m past step of point. Maximum of 6m allowable height of a ladder bracket off the ground.
Safe transition from ladder to roof
REFERENCE - Ladder bracket is installed with entry point anchor assembly to allow connection or transition to a safe position away from the roof edge.
Ladder bracket connection to the structure
REFERENCE - Bracket must connect to the structure with one of the following methods:
○ 3 x HSA R M8 x 55 5/-/-, Drill bit for 8mm thread = 8mm hole.
COMMENTS - Nominate the fixing method used:
REFERENCE - Ladder bracket is installed with entry point anchor assembly to allow connection or transition to a safe position away from the roof edge.
REFERENCE - Strop must be positioned to enable user to reach and connect without falling.
REFERENCE - Entry anchor that do not have strops are positioned to enable user to reach and connect without falling or leaning out from ladder.
REFERENCE - Dissimilar metals are separated by EPDM barrier or sealant.
NOTE: It's acceptable to have some paper remain on the FOAM during installation.
Site clean up and picture evidence if handover is not possible

REFERENCE - Site has been cleared of swarf or other debris installation inspection completed and witnessed by the customers representative. Where a client cannot sign for handover, clear high resolution pictures have been taken of the installed product.
REFERENCE - Entry point signage updated and installed.
Handover operating and systems documentation issued and maximum lanyard length nominated in manual for fall arrest/restraint systems.
I have carried out all necessary inspections and verify that the above items/activities conform to the contract specification/documents
